instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW: What is PM_BATLOW? PM_BATLOW is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.CHGR_PHASE: What is CHGR_PHASE? CHGR_PHASE is charger voltage chopped up into individual slices prior to smoothing where it becomes PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power, orange light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power, orange light
threads.message:
Post voltage on all big coils, if you get any.
Start with L7220 (<SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL>)..
First be sure to have <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power, orange light
threads.message:
L9701 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_SW_LCDBKLT_PWR_SW</SIGNAL> 0.22v
L7260 <SIGNAL>P3V3S5_LL</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.32V ~ 3.35V
L3895 <SIGNAL>TBTBST_BOOST</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_TBTBST</SIGNAL> 2.5V ~ 2.51V
L7220 <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>P5VS3_LL</SIGNAL> 5.13 / 5.14V
L7030 <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>CHGR_PHASE</SIGNAL> 8.4 ~ 8.62V
L7100 <SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_REG_R</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>VCCSAS0_LL</SIGNAL> 0.9V
L7630 PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG / PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG_R 0V
L7330 <SIGNAL>DDRREG_LL</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL> 1.35V
L7550 <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG_R</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_VSWG</SIGNAL> 0V
L7510 <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>CPUIMVP_PHASE1</SIGNAL> 0V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a no power, orange light
threads.message:
" L7630 PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG / PPCPUVCCIO_S0_REG_R 0V "
There is your problem.
First post diode mode to ground.
If short, lift L7630 one side and see where it remains.
If good, post voltage <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>, pins 3, 13, 14.
Be sure R/<CAPACITOR>C7630</CAPACITOR> are good.
